children.title: Enumerator ID

My name is [Enumerator name] and I work for the [International Committee of the Red Cross / Name of National Society]. [ICRC / NS on behalf of the ICRC] is collecting [type of data] from [type of respondents] in [Area/Country]. We would like to ask you some questions about your [type of data]. The purpose of collecting this information is to support [ICRC and/or NS]â€™s operational planning and decisions regarding its [type of intervention] to assist the most vulnerable population in the area. The survey usually takes [length in minutes] to complete. Any information that you provide will only be used by [ICRC and/or NS] and is not subject to further disclosure. Your participation is voluntary. We need your genuine responses and hope that you agree to participate.
Do you consent to being interviewed?

children.title: If Other, specify
Is the respondent the person who was the main responsible to receive the [type of assistance] (at the distribution / encashment point)?
How much [quantity/value of assistance] did your household receive over [the length of programme / last distribution]
How [often/many times] did your household receive assistance over [the length of programme / last distribution]
How many weeks did it take the household to consume [assistance type] received over [the length of programme / last distribution]?
Assistance verification
How far is the [distribution / encashment] point? (in kilometers)
How long does it take you to get to the [distribution / encashment] point? (minutes)
How do you usually get there?
How much does it cost you to travel there (either in gas or in payment for transport)? (local currency)
Are you ever not able to go to the [distribution / encashment / market] because it is either too far or too expensive?
Access to distribution point
How far is the market? (in kilometers)
How long does it take you to get to the market? (minutes)
How do you usually get there?
How much does it cost you to travel there (either in gas or in payment for transport)? (local currency)
Are you ever not able to go to the market because it is either too far or too expensive?
Access to market
Do you feel safe going from your home to the [distribution / encashment] point?
If no, why?
Do you feel safe while you are at the [distribution / encashment] point?
If no, why?
Do you feel safe going home from the [distribution / encashment] point?
If no, why?
Programme site safety
Do you know what organization provided the assistance?
Do you feel you have been told about the ICRC services available to you?
Did you understand what you were told?
Communication
The amount of [assistance type] received was sufficient
If disagree or strongly disagree, which [assistance type items] do you think the amount given to you was not sufficient?
The frequency of the [assistance type] was good
The quality of [assistance type / service provider] was good
If disagree or strongly disagree, please indicate the [assistance type items] that you received with poor quality
The [delivery mechanism / transfer solution] functioned well
The behaviour of staff at the [distribution / encashment] point was good
The germination rate was good
If disagree or strongly disagree, please indicate the [assistance type items] that were not useful for your household
The [assistance type] received was [useful / helpful] for [myself/my household] / [my livelihood]
If disagree or strongly disagree, please indicate the [assistance type items] that were not useful for your household
The support provided to you by the [assistance type] allows you to cover [basic needs/objective]
Did you receive the [assistance type] distributed in time to respond to your [basic needs/objective]?
Perception of Appropriateness of ICRC Assistance
What were the selection criteria for receiving this assistance?
children.hint: Enumerators will ask this question and tick the box if the respondent answers correctly.

children.title: Do you think that the [services ICRC is providing] [is/are] reaching the [households/people] most in need?
How can ICRC do better in reaching the households most in need?
Did the household face any problems in registering for the programme?
In exchange for being included in the assistance, did you have to pay any fee, or give a favour in return?
Perception of registration process and targeting
If you have any suggestions or complaints about ICRC services/projects, do you know how to contact ICRC?
If yes, how do you do this? (Do not read the options, listen and check all that apply)
If Other, specify
Feedback mechanisms
Do you have any additional feedback for the ICRC?
